descript.abstract: Eolian dust provides essential nutrients for biota. Because it is easily transferred by wind, it leaves the remaining soils vulnerable to erosion. This aspect of the dust should be taken into consideration for land-management policies. This paper documents the finding of silt in surficial sediment on part of the Colorado Plateau and also that the recent shift in eolian dust may be due to human activities.
